result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:14 PM Defendant Joshua J. Fair in court, in custody.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Joshua J. Fair. 

3:15 p.m.  Deputy C Kaster is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Cassidy.
3:21 p.m.  ADA Cassidy has the criminal complaint marked as exhibit #P1 and references it.
3:23 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
BY THE COURT:   Record will reflect that the witness had identified the defendant.
ADA Cassidy would ask that exhibit #P1 be entered into evidence.  Atty Bergner has no objection. Received by the Court.
3:24 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Bergner.
ADA Cassidy has no follow up.
Witness is excused.
ADA Cassidy has no further witnesses.
Atty Bergner has no witnesses.
ADA Cassidy has no final argument.
Atty Bergner has no final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Atty Bergner has filed a substitution of Judge.
Judge Zell indicates that this case has been assigned to him.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
